_header: Jesu Christ in Trinity / Only God and persons three
_description: The Earl of Toulous — in 12-line stanzas (aabccbddbeeb)

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Ihesu cryst in triniteO god And persons threGyff vs wele to
                    spedeAnd gyff vs grace so to do…
BodAsh61.Last Lines: …Graunte vs All þi blyssingAmen for charyte
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 83-111; 466-71; 603-5.

BodAsh45I.First Lines:
Iesu Crist in triniteonly god in persons threGraunte vs well
                    to spedeAnd geve vs grace so to do…
BodAsh45I.Last Lines: …There to haue our dwellyngAmen Amen for charite
BodAsh45I.Note:
Lines 1224. In the large flourished initial J is written the name of the
                    scribe ‘ mo-rga-nus’. At the end on F
                        31v is the date: ‘Anno M. D.’ followed by
                        ‘sic transit gloria mundi’.
BodAsh45I.Attributed Title: The Story of the Erle of Tolous (f. 2)

CULFf238.First Lines:
Ihesu cryste yn trynyteOonly god & persons
                    thre…
CULFf238.Last Lines: …There to haue owre wonnyngAmen Amen for charytee
CULFf238.Attributed Title:
here foloweth the Erle of Tolous (f. 63); Here endyth the Erle of Tollous
                    (f. 70vb)
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Ritson,  Joseph,
                        ed.  
             Ancient English Metrical Romances.
         3 vols. London, 1802; rev. Edmund Goldsmid and repr. Edinburgh:
            Goldlsmid, 1884: 3.93-144.
French,  Walter Hoyt,  and  Charles Brockway Hale.  
             Middle English Metrical Romances.
         New York: Prentice-Hall, 1930: 383.
Laskaya,  Anna,  and  Eve Salisbury, eds.  
             The Middle English
                    Breton Lays.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1995: 309-65.

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Ihesu criste god and lorde in trynyteOnely god and persones
                    thre…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…And in þat fyre he þam brentBothe þaire
                    fleshce & þaire bones…
Lincoln91.Note: Ends imperfectly on f. 122, most of which is torn away.
Lincoln91.Attributed Title:
Here bygynnes þe Romance off Dyoclicyane þe Emperour &
                    þe Erle Berade of Tholous And of þe Emprice Beaulilione By gray
                    Espoyere xix (f. 144vb)
Lincoln91.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Derek Stanley,  and  A. E. B. Owen.  
             “Introduction.” 
             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
         London: Scolar Press, 1975.
Lincoln91.Editions:
Lüdtke,  Gustav Otto Daniel,
                        ed.  
             The Erl of Tolous and the Emperes of Almayn.
Sammlung Englischer Denkmäler
         3\. Berlin: Weidmann, 1881; repr. Zurich: Weidmann, 1970: crit. text.
